channel.title: miljko tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from miljko.

item.description: @alexeyguzey More convenient and efficient than trains as they currently run in most of the US? Sure, but so is my kid’s mini scooter so it’s not a high bar.

Where Good Ideas Come From is one of many books from the early 2010s that hasn't aged well. It is important to re-read books you thought were good at least once. Many won't survive the re-reading (applies only to non-fiction) https://t.co/dG7Dgtr81y https://t.co/3oIeyxLYt6
Yet another reminder of @sapinker's delusions. Better angels of our nature indeed… https://t.co/yOP8BhXtpt

"…it is the Weathervanes who feel most sorry for. Desperately wanting to be 'a part of the discussion', but lacking the tools to do so, …limiting the scope and breadth of what the rest of us can think and say in the popular press" Strong Aaron Burr vibes https://t.co/h5IfTmiN2Z
Best beer, best chocolate, and now the best passport. Jealous of the Belgians… https://t.co/8QW2eXUHyq
@nntaleb And then there's the Balkans, where the only thing different countries can unite around is redrawing maps.
Nisam zamišljao da ću ikada po tviterima braniti ruski narod od pomahnitalih masa. Eto, svašta čovek doživi. Ali ono što Srbija radi po pitanju rata u Ukrajini je neodbranjivo.
@kostimoshenko @arturi @marcoarment @ArtfulDodger183 Understood. I wish you and your family all the best!

@kostimoshenko @arturi @marcoarment @ArtfulDodger183 You mean brave Russian like Navalny, who then went on to receive a neurotoxin and imprisonment as a reward? All while EU countries were all too happy to deal with an autocrat for a good deal on gas. Tale as old as time (and replicated throughout the world even now)
@cmall @marcoarment @ArtfulDodger183 So were Milošević’s in Serbia back when I was there. There are many reasons why you can’t take that number at face value, even if it were true.

@cmall @marcoarment @ArtfulDodger183 Yes, between the small user base, the crashing ruble, the possible App Store ban, and no content actually being removed we can all agree that it would be a symbolic gesture. I don’t like what it symbolizes: that those who suffer through a dictatorship should be doubly punished.

@marcoarment @ArtfulDodger183 Please reconsider. Not being able to access Overcast won't mean anything to Putin or his oligarchs. It would only "confirm" to those in Russia who've already lost their voice via the social media ban that the outside world is against them.
@barttels2 I, for one, will continue listening to the Slavic March. It gets more and more complex as decades go by, it seems. https://t.co/bjfihRnsTy

As someone who was on the receiving end of indiscriminate sanctions and discrimination in the 90s I can confirm that the broad cancelation of anything Russian-related is not only useless, it is counterproductive. Wouldn't be surprised if Igor/Linda were behind some of those. https://t.co/owm2y2K5En
Apropos https://t.co/YqH4RjDNy2
@Korean_Jedi @trishankkarthik @wendyweeww @nntaleb @ggreenwald @Snowden If he doesn’t have freedom of speech why should I trust anything he says?

@Korean_Jedi @trishankkarthik @wendyweeww @nntaleb @ggreenwald @Snowden His main interaction with the world outside Russia has been Twitter. On it, he routinely attacked the US without saying a word about his polonium-peddling, dissident-poisoning host country. I don’t know, you tell me how things may have evolved.

@Korean_Jedi @trishankkarthik @wendyweeww @nntaleb @ggreenwald @Snowden About the initial reasons, yes. It’s unfortunate he ended up in Russia. Once there, things may have evolved. And from his tweets over the past few years, it seems like they have.
@trishankkarthik @wendyweeww @Korean_Jedi @nntaleb @ggreenwald @Snowden Bingo. Hard to beleive Snowden was static, too.
@VPrasadMDMPH Great episode. Good thing Twitter isn't real life, or I'd be worried about Dr. Damania.

@trishankkarthik @nntaleb @ggreenwald @Snowden Count me in with those who changed their mind, yet again, thank to Taleb. Still not sure if he was an agent, a useful idiot doubling down on idiocy, or something in between. But the outcome is the same.
These are, in fact, quite good (or, to translate from Slavic to American: Absolutely Amazing!!!1!) https://t.co/UTq962kMu2
Calling this an “opinion” is a bit of a stretch, no? https://t.co/Xk7atsJjgq

@ManniMD1 @oncology_bg @AaronGoodman33 @VPrasadMDMPH Yep, that paragraph was exactly what I had in mind! Do you have names of the drugs tested as part of the dataset? That could help answer the question.

@ManniMD1 @oncology_bg @AaronGoodman33 @VPrasadMDMPH Interesting. The Wesson review (https://t.co/8hPhONLCrN) doesn't note the type of non-randomized trials that increased from 2015 to 2020, so hard to see why their explanation of decreased randomization should be accepted over something less nefarious, like more drugs being tested
